maml:description.maml:para: Block users from a property.

Blocks a user from accessing one or more properties by specifying their IDs. > Note: You can retrieve the property IDs in the IAM API by running the `Get-IAMProperty` operation. The property IDs are equivalent to the asset IDs from the Property API.
Unique identifier for each property. To get this value, run Get-IAMProperty.
Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run Get-IAMUser.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each property. To get this value, run Get-IAMProperty.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run Get-IAMUser.
Deactivate credentials.

Deactivates all credentials for a given client ID or deactivates an individual credential by its credential ID. > Note: If you don't specify a value for the `-ClientID` parameter, it takes the value `self` and operate on the API client you're using to perform this operation.
Unique identifier for each API client. To get this value, run Get-IAMAPIClient.
Unique identifier for each credential. To get this value for your credentials, run Get-IAMAPICredential.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for each API client. To get this value, run Get-IAMAPIClient.
Unique identifier for each credential. To get this value for your credentials, run Get-IAMAPICredential.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Disable IP allowlist.
Disables the IP allowlist on your account. After you disable it, your users can access Control Center regardless of their IP address or who assigns it.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Enable IP allowlist.

Enables the IP allowlist on your account. Before you enable it, you need to add at least one IP address to allow access to Control Center. The allowlist can't be empty when the IP allowlist is enabled.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Find an account switch key.
Finds an account switch key for a given search term. The search terms don't need to be exact. Note that a single customer can have multiple account switch keys.
Filters results by `accountId` or `accountName`. Enter at least three characters to filter the results by substring.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

View contact types.

Gets the supported contact types. You should use the values from this operation to add or update your user's contact type. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserContactTypes` operation before modifying your contact type.

View languages.

Gets supported languages. You should use the values from this operation to set your user's preferred language. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserLanguages` operation before setting your preferred language.

View password policy.

Retrieves the password policy for an account. You should use the values from this operation to set your user's password policy. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserPasswordPolicy` operation before setting your password policy.

View products.

Gets the products your users can subscribe to and receive notifications for on an account. You should use the values from this operation to set your user's product notifications. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserProducts` operation before setting your product notifications.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

View states.

Gets the supported U.S. states or Canadian provinces. You should use the values from this operation to add or update your user's state or province. If your user's state or province is unknown, use 'TBD'. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserStates` operation before modifying your state or province.
Filters the results by country, but only returns lists of states and provinces for `USA` and `Canada`.

View timeout policies.

Gets the supported session timeout policies. The `name` for each timeout period is in minutes, and the time `value` is in seconds. You should use the values from this operation to set your user's session timeout policy. If you're not an admin, you should run the `Get-IAMUserTimeoutPolicy` operation before setting your session timeout policy.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Get an API client.

Gets API clients or returns a specific API client by its ID. If you want to retrieve your own API client, specify a value of `self` in the `-ClientID` parameter. You can optionally filter the results by adding additional switch parameters, such as `-Actions`, `-GroupAccess`, `-APIAccess`, `-Credentials`, or `-IPACL`.
Lists only the APIs the user can access.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Includes actions you can perform on the object.
Unique identifier for each API client. To get this value, run Get-IAMAPIClient.
Includes API user's credentials.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Includes the API client's group access.
Includes the API client's IP list restriction.

Get a group.

Gets all groups or returns a specific group by its ID that you, as an admin, can manage for the current account and contract type or other managed accounts. > Note: It's different to how other APIs return the group data, that is, the IAM API nests groups inside their parents. If you want a flattened list of groups without nesting, use the `-Flatten` parameter.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Includes actions you can perform on the object.
Collapse the response so that child groups are not nested within parents and the response is a single-level array.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Includes actions you can perform on the object.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Collapse the response so that child groups are not nested within parents and the response is a single-level array.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get users affected by moving a group.

Gets users who are affected when you move a group. Users may lose or gain access to resources depending on the roles and permissions inherited from the new parent group. Users with a `-UserType` of `lostAccess` lose their access to the source group. If the `-UserType` is `gainAccess`, they gain access to the resources in the source group. Users who have inherited access to a group lose access to that group if it moves out of its hierarchy that gives them those access rights. If the group moves to another parent group to which they have access, they still have access to the group you move. Likewise, when you move a group to a new location, users who inherit their access rights from the new parent group gain access to the resources in the group you move.
Unique identifier for a group you want to move.
Unique identifier for the destination a group you're putting the source group into.
Filters the list by users who have `lostAccess` or the reverse `gainAccess`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Unique identifier for the destination a group you're putting the source group into.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get a property.

Gets all properties or returns a specific property by its ID. > Note: The property ID in this API isn't the same as the property ID from the Property API. If you have the data only from the Property API, the property ID from the IAM API is equivalent to the asset ID from the Property API.

Lock a user's account.

Locks a specified user's account, preventing them from accessing Control Center. The result shows in the user data as a read-only `isLocked`: `true` attribute. To allow the user to access Control Center, run the `Unlock-IAMUser` operation. This sets the `isLocked` attribute to `false`.

Move a property.

Moves a property from one group to another. You can only move a property into another group within the same group hierarchy. Depending on your role in the destination group, you may lose access to resources the property uses. After moving a property, run the `Get-IAMGroupMoveAffectedUsers` operation to determine which users gained or lost access to that property.
Unique identifier for each property. To get this value, run Get-IAMProperty.

Create an API client.

Creates a new API client. Optionally, you can automatically assign a credential for the client when you create it. If you choose not to assign the credential automatically, see the Create authentication credentials (https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/set-up-authentication-credentials)guide for details. > Note: As the format of the request body is complex, if you have an existing user, it's recommended that you retrieve it with the `Get-IAMAPIClient` operation, edit it locally, and pipe the edited object to this function.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

Create a user.

Creates a user or clones an existing user's role assignments. Optionally, you can send a randomly generated one-time use password to the new user with the `SendEmail` switch parameter. Delete a CIDR block.

Deletes a CIDR block from the IP allowlist. After you delete a CIDR block, any requests from the IP addresses you deleted fail the next time someone tries to log in from that address. Users accessing Control Center from an IP address you delete aren't automatically logged out of Control Center at the time you delete the IP address. When the IP allowlist is enabled for your account, you can't delete the last CIDR block in the allowlist or the CIDR block allowing access to the current user. There are no restrictions on CIDR block deletion when the IP allowlist is disabled on your account.
Unique identifier for each CIDR block. To get this value, run Get-IAMCIDRBlock.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Resets your user's multi-factor authentication method the next time they log in to Control Center. You can reset it either for your own user or an individual user specified by their `-UIIdentityID`. `TFA` indicates two-factor authentication. `MFA` indicates Akamai MFA authentication.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Edit a role.

Adds or removes a role's capabilities (granted roles) along with other data, such as the name and description. When you modify a role, those changes affect existing API clients. Review all API clients under this role before modifying.
Unique identifier for each role.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Update a user.
Modifies a specified user's information. It's recommended that you retrieve the user's information via the `Get-IAMUser` operation, edit it locally, then pipe the result to this function.

Update blocked properties.
Removes or grants user access to properties. By default, users have access to all properties in a group. By not including a blocked property in the request, you're unlocking it.
Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run Get-IAMUser.

Set a user's multi-factor authentication.

Sets a specified user's multi-factor authentication to one of the values: `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`. Your users have five login attempts with MFA or 2FA before their account is locked. If their account is locked, run the `Reset-IAMUserMFA` operation to unlock it.
Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run Get-IAMUser.
A user's multi-factor authentication method, either `TFA`, `MFA`, or `NONE`.

Rotate your password.

Sets the password for your own user or another. When resetting your own password, you need to provide the current password. The `-CurrentPassword` and `-NewPassword` parameters accept only a secure string.

Unlock a user's account.

Unlocks a specified user's account, allowing them to access Control Center. The result shows in the user data as a read-only `isLocked`:`false` attribute. To prevent the user from accessing Control Center, run the `Lock-IAMUser` operation. This sets the `isLocked` attribute to `true`.
Unique identifier for each user. To get this value, run Get-IAMUser.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
